intro: Bunium cornigerum, commonly known as the corned beef plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to central and southern Europe, as well as parts of western Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Bunium cornigerum is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
